issue.title: CVE-2016-3720 allows attackers to have unspecified impact via unknown vectors

issue.body: In NVD a security impact was raised: https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2016-3720

issue.title: CVE-2016-3720 XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability in XmlMapper

repository.name: jackson-dataformat-xml
repository.description: Extension for Jackson JSON processor that adds support for serializing POJOs as XML (and deserializing from XML) as an alternative to JSON

issue.body: What is being done to address alleged vulnerability [CVE-2016-3720](https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2016-3720)?

body: Will you update [the corresponding entry in the NVD](https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2016-3720) with fix versions?

@astellingwerf I had nothing to do with filing CVEs in question nor have access. I have tried contacting Red Hat and we'll see where that leads. If anyone has contacts to follow up with that would be helpful.

issue.title: Ensure DOM parsing defaults to not expanding external entities

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
Since there were issues wrt general XML handling:

https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/issues/190

it would make sense to review smaller but relevant concers wrt DOM types that databind supports

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/38017676/small-fix-for-cve-2016-3720-with-older-versions-of-jackson-all-1-9-11-and-in-ja/38018454#38018454

issue.title: Jackson dependency causes OWASP alerts. Change to Jackson version 2.7.4

repository.name: docker-client
repository.description: INACTIVE: A simple docker client for the JVM

issue.body:
OWASP Validation obtains the following vulnerabilities for dependences:

Vulnerable Dependencies
CVE     CWE     Severity (CVSS)  Dependency
CVE-2016-3720       High (10.0)     jackson-annotations-2.6.0.jar
CVE-2016-3720       High (10.0)     jackson-core-2.6.7.jar
CVE-2016-3720       High (10.0)     jackson-databind-2.6.7.jar
CVE-2016-3720       High (10.0)     jackson-datatype-guava-2.6.7.jar
CVE-2016-3720       High (10.0)     jackson-jaxrs-base-2.6.7.jar
CVE-2016-3720       High (10.0)     jackson-jaxrs-json-provider-2.6.7.jar
CVE-2016-3720       High (10.0)     jackson-module-jaxb-annotations-2.6.7.jar

This vulnerability is fixed in jackson 2.7.4:

https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/issues/190

This dependency should be updated to avoid alerts in OWASP checking.

body:
Have also followed up with RH via their ticket that filed the vulnerability - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1328427 
It may be due to the ticket status still showing as NEW and need a resolution and/or re-testing.
@brettcave thank you for your help with bugzilla entry. 2.7.4 is the version here; and 2.8.0 includes fixed default settings.
Thanks @cowtowncoder . Both 2.7.4 and 2.8.0 still fail CVE / OWASP checks as the database needs to be updated, waiting on RH to update it, assuming it was logged based on their bugzilla issue.

issue.title: [SPARK-11753][SQL][test-hadoop2.2] Make allowNonNumericNumbers option work

repository.name: spark
repository.description: Apache Spark - A unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing

issue.body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

Jackson suppprts `allowNonNumericNumbers` option to parse non-standard non-numeric numbers such as "NaN", "Infinity", "INF".  Currently used Jackson version (2.5.3) doesn't support it all. This patch upgrades the library and make the two ignored tests in `JsonParsingOptionsSuite` passed.
## How was this patch tested?

`JsonParsingOptionsSuite`.

issue.title: False positives for CVE-2016-3720 for several jackson libraries

repository.name: DependencyCheck
repository.description: OWASP dependency-check is a software composition analysis utility that detects publicly disclosed vulnerabilities in application dependencies.

issue.body:
[CVE-2016-3270](http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2016-3720) is falsely reported for the following libraries and probably all other com.fasterxml.jackson libraries for all versions (e.g. [version] = 2.5.0, 2.5.4, 2.6.5)
- jackson-annotations-[version].jar
- jackson-core-[version].jar
- jackson-databind-[version].jar
- jackson-datatype-jdk8-[version].jar
- jackson-datatype-jsr310-[version].jar

Am I right that we can't use the CPE as an suppression rule here as that would exclude the vulnerable library [jackson-dataformat-xml](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml) as well?

issue.title: Reduce chance of XXE

repository.name: woodstox
repository.description: The gold standard Stax XML API implementation. Now at Github.

rename.from: Ensure that defaults for `XMLInputFactory` have expansion of external parsed general entities disabled
rename.to: Ensure that defaults for `XMLInputFactory` have expansion of external parsed general entities disabled [CVE-2016-3720]

issue.title: Fix possible XXE during XML schema version detection

repository.name: cyclonedx-core-java
repository.description: CycloneDX SBOM Model and Utils for Creating and Validating BOMs

issue.body:
During some testing, it was found that the parser for XML was vulnerable to XML External Entity (XXE) Processing.

After further investigation from Sonatype team, it was found it was due to the XPath Processing done to get the schema version
